page.title: 03HOLY TRINITY CHURCH
page.content: The moment when it was decided to build a new church is unclear.That it was built with the dedication and affection of many local christians, there is no doubt.Tothe gifts of local families like the Middleton Evans and the Green Prices were added the subscriptions of many visitors to the town.At the opening of the new church on Wednesday,26th July,1871,the local paper listed the very considerable sums given by visitors_Â£300 from the Pump House,Â£125 from the Rock House and Â£40 from the Llanerch.The cost of erection was Â£2,457 _an amount, which may make us all smile in these inflation_ridden days,with which the architect_Tom Nicholson of Hereford was to design a building in the 'Early Decorated' style capable of seating 500 people.
